definition[0]: an ancient Egyptian image of a lion with a human head, lying down
definition[1]: a large, very ancient sphinx which is close to the Pyramids of El Giza in Egypt and is visited by many tourists
definition[2]: in Greek mythology, a creature with the head of a woman and the body of a lion. She lay outside Thebes and killed people who could not answer her riddle (=very difficult question). Oedipus answered the riddle, and the Sphinx killed herself.
